subject: Art & Design
title: The Corset: Beauty, Power, and Controversy
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Corset: Beauty, Power, and Controversy.

hook.text: The corset shaped Western fashion for 400 years.

buildup.text: Corsets appeared in the 16th century, creating an idealized hourglass silhouette through boning and tight lacing.

discovery.text: They were engineering: whalebone, steel, and precise construction. A well-made corset was both craft and architecture.

climax.text: Paul Poiret abolished the corset in 1906, liberating women's bodies.

punchline.text: The corset is gone. The debate about whose body fashion serves is not.

quiz.question: Who is credited with liberating fashion from the corset?
options: Paul Poiret, who introduced loose, uncorseted silhouettes around 1906
Queen Victoria, who banned corsets in 1850
Coco Chanel, who replaced them with jersey fabric
